top_comments.comment: Visit https://simplisafe.com/modustrial to learn more and to get at least 30% off your SimpliSafe security system!

comments_since_last_sample.body: The matt black pulls will look amazing with the maple cabinets! Exciting process👍😎

My vote is for the pulls. When you're working in the kitchen oftentimes your hands can get a bit "dirty" (grease, flour, or whatever you're working with) so when you go to open your doors/drawers  if you have to press in the middle of the drawers all the time you'll be leaving smudges and fingerprints. With pulls that stays contained to the pulls and will keep your cabinetry cleaner longer. 

Then depending on the black paint you use on your cabinetry, test to see how well that cleans before commiting! Kitchens get dirty, especially near your cooktop. Best of luck!
this layout violates the main rule of an unobstructed work triangle between sink, stove, fridge.

I like the pulls...less chance of something failing in the future and soft-close is good...but your gonna want full extension glides.
And as for the mdf...what your thinking about is hdf (high density) but all the kitchens ive installed have been all ply (including shelves) with a solid face. I haven't seen the other yet
"You don't put 26 sheets of plywood on the Gti." Darn right.
I find push to open annoying, a friends house has it. The drawers always open when you're cooking and bump them!
Do you consider the left handed functionality. Or the individual that navigates with a child on their hip 🤣.....
Push to open is my choice.
Push to open is just so cool. It definitely makes the overall look a lot cleaner
What’s the software you used to make the kitchen? 4:27
Definitely push to open, simply put "keeping it clean"
Push to open is a no , fingermarks everywhere . Go the pulls
Go with a Matt brass finish on the finger pulls.  It adds a pop to your black finish cabinets.

Definitely go with the separate stove top. I do think having the bar with the island is worth exploring further, maybe something modular? - I also like the manual pulls for the doors, since they match so well.
I would say pull for sure. It just feels unnatural to push. Lol
